node.title: Alleged mini meth lab and firearms discovered in PNG hotel, but Australian manager won't face drug charges
node.alt: Equipment scattered across a bed in a hotel room. There is a cup with a white substance in it, in the foreground.
node.description: Police in PNG sayÂ outdated laws have left them unable to lay drug charges against the Australian manager of a Port Moresby hotel where an alleged clandestine meth lab and illegal firearms were discovered.
node.content:
["Papua New Guinea police say\u00a0outdated drug laws have left them unable to lay drug charges against the Australian manager of a Port Moresby hotel where an alleged clandestine meth lab and illegal firearms were discovered.", "Sanctuary\u00a0Hotel Resort and Spa group operations manager\u00a0Jamie Pang, 43, was arrested after a raid\u00a0at the hotel on November 16 but he has not been charged with any drug-related offences.", "There are no laws in PNG that prohibit the production, sale or\u00a0use of methamphetamine.", "The case has added fuel to calls to amend Papua New Guinea's Dangerous Drugs Act 1954.", "Pang has pleaded guilty to 11 firearms charges and will face court on\u00a0Friday, according to local media.", "", "
Jamie Pang (left) is the group operations manager at the\u00a0Sanctuary\u00a0Hotel Resort and Spa in Port Moresby.(Supplied: Royal Papua New Guinea Constabulary)
", "The Royal Papua New Guinea Constabulary (RPNGC) worked alongside PNG Customs Services, Australian Federal Police, and the United States Department of Homeland Security on the operation.", "RPNGC Assistant Commissioner Donald Yamasombi, who headed the inter-agency investigation team, said the current laws made his job difficult.\u00a0", "\"It's just waste of time and resources, really, and we get no justice done to it.\"", "", "
A round-bottom flask attached to a\u00a0stand and clamp found during the raid on the hotel.(Supplied: Royal Papua New Guinea Constabulary)
", "Assistant Commissioner Yamasombi said the Dangerous Drugs Act 1954 needed to be overhauled to reflect the current threat that drugs like methamphetamine posed\u00a0to PNG.", "
Drug laws shake-up
", "PNG's Police Minister\u00a0William Onglo said he supported\u00a0amendments to the old law.", "In a statement, he said the government\u00a0would push for the legislation to be \"reviewed, amended and scheduled for presentation in parliament in the near future\".", "There have been a string of drug busts in the country in recent years, including in July and August 2020 when more than 500 kilograms of cocaine was seized\u00a0and an Australian pilot was arrested\u00a0after a plane believed to be linked to drug trafficking crashed in Port Moresby.", "In October, the Post Courier reported on a 31-year-old Cairns man who was charged with smuggling methamphetamine into PNG.", "While methamphetamine trafficking is not illegal in PNG, smuggling undeclared goods is an offence under PNG's Customs Act.", "Australia Pacific Security College\u00a0policy fellow\u00a0Jose Sousa-Santos said changes to drug laws\u00a0needed to be two-pronged\u00a0and address the issue of corruption.", "", "
Jose Sousa-Santos says\u00a0any law\u00a0changes also need\u00a0to address corruption.(Supplied:\u00a0Jos\u00e9 Sousa-Santos)
", "\"You can't address the issue of trans-national crime and syndicates and the risk of trans-national\u00a0crime without addressing the linkages to corruption that come along with that,\" Mr\u00a0Sousa-Santos said.", "\"That could be corruption in not just agencies but also in government, and\u00a0that in itself is a cancer which needs to be addressed.\"", "He said there were avenues PNG could take to address the methamphetamine trafficking problem, including requesting\u00a0assistance from the Pacific Islands Forum, as was done by Tonga.", "\"In 2019, Tonga\u00a0requested\u00a0for the Pacific Islands Forum to develop a five-year national policy on illicit drugs,\" Mr\u00a0Sousa-Santos said.", "\"This led to Tonga\u00a0pushing through a tough new drug law this year.", "\"And that in itself has given the police and the judiciary\u00a0the tools to be able to now confront the methamphetamine epidemic, and also the trafficking of drugs that is affecting the country.\"", "On Tuesday, PNG's Minister for Justice Bryan Kramer said a new\u00a0Controlled Substance Bill was being finalised for endorsement by the National Executive Council, for tabling in parliament, the Post Courier reported.", "
'They should be deported'
", "", "
Ms Setae says foreigners found to be importing or producing drugs into PNG should be deported.(Supplied:\u00a0Spotlight Initiative)
", "Community leader Susan Setae said PNG\u00a0was vulnerable to the influence of dangerous drugs.", "She said she was\u00a0concerned about the impact on\u00a0younger generations.", "\"If it goes out into the rural communities, we are done,\" Ms Setae said.", "\"But what can we do when the children are out on the streets? With their peer groups and peer pressures? How can we help them to see what is right and what is wrong?", "\"And therefore, government has to take very, very strong issue.\"", "Ms Setae said foreign nationals found to be importing or producing drugs in the country should be deported.\u00a0", "She said the local community had to rise up and speak out against the use of dangerous drugs."]
